member.name: T:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.Diagnostics
member.summary: Provides tools to help investigate errors occuring in library methods.

member.name: E:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.Diagnostics.Error
member.summary: Raised when error occurs in one of the methods in the library

member.name: T:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilAnalysis
member.summary: Provides static methods that assist in parsing and analysing CIL bytecode

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilAnalysis.GetTypeName(System.Type)
member.summary: Gets the name of .NET type in CIL notation
member.param: Type for which name is requested
member.remarks: Returns short type name, such as int32, if it exists. Otherwise returns full name.

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilAnalysis.GetTypeFullName(System.Type)
member.summary: Gets the full name of .NET type in CIL notation
member.param: Type for which name is requested
member.remarks: Returns fully qualified name, such as class [mscorlib]System.String

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilAnalysis.EscapeString(System.String)
member.summary: Escapes special characters in the specified string, using rules similar to what are applied to C# string literals
member.param: The string to escape

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilAnalysis.MethodToText(System.Reflection.MethodBase)
member.summary: Returns specified method CIL code as string
member.param: Method for which to retrieve CIL
member.remarks: The CIL code returned by this API is intended mainly for reading, not compiling. It is not guaranteed to be a valid input for CIL assembler.

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilAnalysis.GetReferencedMethods(System.Reflection.MethodBase)
member.summary: Gets all methods that are referenced by the specified method
member.param: Method for which to retrieve referenced methods
member.remarks: Referenced member is a member that appears as an operand of instruction in source method's body. For example, if the source method calls `Foo` method or creates delegate pointing to `Foo`, `Foo` is referenced by the source method.

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilAnalysis.GetReferencedMembers(System.Reflection.MethodBase)
member.summary: Gets all members (fields or methods) referenced by specified method
member.param: Method for which to retrieve referenced members
member.remarks: Referenced member is a member that appears as an operand of instruction in source method's body. For example, if the source method calls `Foo` method or creates delegate pointing to `Foo`, `Foo` is referenced by the source method.

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilAnalysis.GetReferencedMembers(System.Reflection.MethodBase,CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.MemberCriteria)
member.summary: Gets members (fields or methods) referenced by specified method that match specified criteria
member.param: Method for which to retrieve referenced members
A combination of bitwise flags that control what kind of members are retrieved
member.exception: Failed to retrieve method body for the method
member.remarks: Referenced member is a member that appears as an operand of instruction in source method's body. For example, if the source method calls `Foo` method or creates delegate pointing to `Foo`, `Foo` is referenced by the source method.

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilAnalysis.GetReferencedMethods(System.Type)
member.summary: Get all methods that are referenced by the code of the specified type
member.param: Type for which to retrieve referenced methods
member.remarks: Referenced member is a member that appears as an operand of instruction in any of the type's methods.

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilAnalysis.GetReferencedMembers(System.Type)
member.summary: Gets all members referenced by the code of specified type
member.param: Type for which to retrieve referenced members
member.remarks: Referenced member is a member that appears as an operand of instruction in any of the type's methods.

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilAnalysis.GetReferencedMembers(System.Type,CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.MemberCriteria)
member.summary: Gets members referenced by the code of specified type that match specified criteria
member.param: Type for which to retrieve referenced members
A combination of bitwise flags that control what kind of members are retrieved
member.remarks: Referenced member is a member that appears as an operand of instruction in any of the type's methods.

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilAnalysis.GetReferencedMethods(System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary: Get all methods that are referenced by the code in the specified assembly
member.param: Assembly for which to retrieve referenced methods
member.remarks: Referenced member is a member that appears as an operand of instruction in any of the assembly's methods.

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilAnalysis.GetReferencedMembers(System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary: Gets all members referenced by the code of specified assembly
member.param: Assembly for which to retrieve referenced members
member.remarks: Referenced member is a member that appears as an operand of instruction in any of the assembly's methods.

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilAnalysis.GetReferencedMembers(System.Reflection.Assembly,CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.MemberCriteria)
member.summary: Gets members referenced by the code of specified assembly that match specified criteria
member.param: Assembly for which to retrieve referenced members
A combination of bitwise flags that control what kind of members are retrieved
member.remarks: Referenced member is a member that appears as an operand of instruction in any of the assembly's methods.

member.name: T:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.MemberCriteria
member.summary: Represents bitwise flags that define what kinds of members are requested
member.remarks: External members are members defined in different assembly then the method which references them, not to be confused with `external` keyword in C#. Internal members are members defined in the same assembly as referencing method, similarly, not to be confused with `internal` keyword or `InternalCall` attribute. If you specify a combination of flags that does not match anything (i.e., if you define neither external nor internal members, or neither methods nor fields) when requesting referenced members, empty collection is returned.

member.name: F:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.MemberCriteria.External
member.summary: Return external (not from the same assembly as containing method) members

member.name: F:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.MemberCriteria.Internal
member.summary: Return internal (from the same assembly as containing method) members

member.name: F:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.MemberCriteria.Methods
member.summary: Return methods (including constructors)

member.name: F:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.MemberCriteria.Fields
member.summary: Return fields

Target TextWriter object. If null or omitted, standard output will be used.

member.name: T:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraph
member.summary: Represents a CIL graph, a graph that reflects a flow of control between CIL instructions in the method

remarks.para: CIL graph is a directed graph with nodes representing CIL instructions withing method body and edges representing how control flows between them when runtime executes method. The root of the graph is the first instruction of the method. Each node stores a reference to the next instruction (which is usually executed after it) and, if it's a jump instruction, a reference to the branch target (an instruction that would be executed if the condition for the jump is met). For convenience, each instruction serving as branch target is assigned a label, a string that identify it. The last instruction of the method has null as its next instruction reference.
Use method to create CIL graph for a method.

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraph.Create(System.Reflection.MethodBase)
member.summary: Returns that represents a specified method
member.param: Method for which to build CIL graph

member.name: F:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraph._Root
member.summary: A root node of this graph (the first instruction in the method)

member.name: F:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraph._Method
member.summary: A method object for which this graph is built

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraph.#ctor(CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraphNode,System.Reflection.MethodBase)
member.summary: Creates new CIL graph. (Insfrastructure; not intended for user code)
member.param: Root node
Method associated with this graph object
member.remarks: Use method to create CIL graph for a method instead of using this contructor.

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraph.PrintSignature(System.IO.TextWriter)
member.summary: Writes the signature of the method represented by this graph into the specified TextWriter
member.param: The destination TextWriter

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraph.PrintDefaults(System.IO.TextWriter)
member.summary: Writes default parameter values of the method represented by this graph into the specified TextWriter
member.param: The destination TextWriter

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraph.PrintAttributes(System.IO.TextWriter)
member.summary: Writes custom attributes of the method represented by this graph into the specified TextWriter
member.param: The destination TextWriter

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraph.PrintHeader(System.IO.TextWriter)
member.summary: Writes the method header code of the method represented by this graph into the specified TextWriter
member.param: The destination TextWriter
member.remarks: The method header in CLI contains information such as stack size and local variables.

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraph.Print(System.IO.TextWriter,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes the CIL code corresponding to this graph into the specified TextWriter, optionally including signature, default parameter values, attributes and method header
member.param: The destination TextWriter, or null to use standard output
Indicates that method signature should be included in the output
Indicates that default parameter values should be included in the output
Indicates that custom attributes should be included in the output
Indicates that method header should be included in the output

remarks.para: The CIL code produced by this API is intended mainly for reading, not compiling. It is not guaranteed to be a valid input for CIL assembler.
Method header contains information such as maximum stack size and local variable types.

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraph.ToSyntaxTree
member.summary: Gets the syntax tree for the method represented by this graph
member.returns: The root method definition node of the syntax tree

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraph.ToText
member.summary: Returns CIL code corresponding to this graph as a string
member.remarks: The CIL code returned by this API is intended mainly for reading, not compiling. It is not guaranteed to be a valid input for CIL assembler.

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraph.ToString
member.summary: Returns the signature of the method represented by this graph

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraph.GetNodes
member.summary: Enumerates nodes in this graph

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraph.GetInstructions
member.summary: Enumerates all instructions represented by this graph's nodes

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraph.EmitTo(System.Reflection.Emit.ILGenerator,System.Func{CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilInstruction,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Emits the entire content of this CIL graph into the specified IL generator, optionally calling user callback for each processed instruction.
member.param: Target IL generator.
User callback to be called for each processed instruction.
member.remarks: Passing user callback into this method enables you to filter instructions that you want to be emitted into target IL generator. Return to skip emitting instruction, or to emit instruction.

member.name: P:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraph.Root
member.summary: Gets a root node of this graph (the first instruction in the method)

member.name: P:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraph.Method
member.summary: Gets a method for which this graph is built

member.name: T:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraphNode
member.summary: Represents a node in the CIL graph. A node describes an instruction and its connection with other instructions
member.remarks: See class documentation for more information about CIL graphs.

member.name: F:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraphNode._Instruction
member.summary: CIL instruction associated with this node

member.name: F:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraphNode._Name
member.summary: Optional label name associated with this node

member.name: F:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraphNode._Previous
member.summary: A reference to the node that represents instruction directly preceding current instruction in the method bytecode

member.name: F:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraphNode._Next
member.summary: A reference to the node that represents instruction directly following current instruction in the method bytecode

member.name: F:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraphNode._BranchTarget
member.summary: A reference to the node that represents instruction which is a target of the current instruction, if applicable

member.name: F:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraphNode._SwitchTargets
member.summary: An array of nodes that represents the jump table of the switch instruction, if applicable

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraphNode.GetSwitchTargets
member.summary: Gets an array of nodes that represents the jump table of the switch instruction, if applicable
member.remarks: Jump table is the sequence of instructions corresponding to the switch instruction. When runtime processes switch instruction, it will transfer control to one of the instructions based on the value pushed to the stack. For non-switch instructions, returns an empty array.

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraphNode.#ctor
member.summary: Creates new CilGraphNode object

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraphNode.ToString
member.summary: Returns text representation of this node as a line of CIL code
member.returns: String that contatins a text representation of this node

member.name: P:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraphNode.Instruction
member.summary: Gets CIL instruction associated with this node

member.name: P:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraphNode.Name
member.summary: Gets label name associated with this node
member.remarks: Label names are assigned to instruction that serve as branch targets for convenience. If the instruction is not used as target, the value is empty string.

member.name: P:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraphNode.Previous
member.summary: Gets a reference to the node that represents instruction directly preceding current instruction in the method bytecode
member.remarks: For the first instruction in the method body, the value is null.

member.name: P:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraphNode.Next
member.summary: Gets a reference to the node that represents instruction directly following current instruction in the method bytecode
member.remarks: Next instruction will be normally executed after current one, unless it is a jump instruction and the condition for jump is met. For the last instruction of the method body, the value is null.

member.name: P:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraphNode.BranchTarget
member.summary: Gets a reference to the node that represents instruction which is a target of the current instruction, if applicable
member.remarks: Branch target is an instruction which would be called after current one if the condition for jump instruction is met. For non-jump instructions, the value is null.

member.name: T:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraphNodeMutable
member.summary: A mutable version of CilGraphNode class
member.remarks: Graph nodes are exposed as immutable objects by API of this library, such as method, because usually you don't need to alter their properties. However, these nodes are created as mutable objects and their actual runtime type is CilGraphNodeMutable; you can cast them to that type if you need to set their properties.

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraphNodeMutable.#ctor(CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilInstruction)
member.summary: Creates new mutable CIL graph node object
member.param: An instruction associated with this node

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraphNodeMutable.SetSwitchTargets(CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraphNode[])
member.summary: Sets the array of nodes that represents the jump table of the switch instruction
member.remarks: Jump table is the sequence of instructions corresponding to the switch instruction. When runtime processes switch instruction, it will transfer control to one of the instructions based on the value pushed to the stack.

member.name: P:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraphNodeMutable.Instruction
member.summary: Gets or sets CIL instruction associated with this node

member.name: P:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraphNodeMutable.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets label name associated with this node
member.remarks: Label names are assigned to instruction that serve as branch targets for convenience. If the instruction is not used as target, the value is empty string.

member.name: P:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraphNodeMutable.Previous
member.summary: Gets or sets a reference to the node that represents instruction directly preceding current instruction in the method bytecode
member.remarks: For the first instruction in the method body, the value is null.

member.name: P:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraphNodeMutable.Next
member.summary: Gets or sets a reference to the node that represents instruction directly following current instruction in the method bytecode
member.remarks: Next instruction will be normally executed after current one, unless it is a jump instruction and the condition for jump is met. For the last instruction of the method body, the value is null.

member.name: P:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraphNodeMutable.BranchTarget
member.summary: Gets or sets a reference to the node that represents instruction which is a target of the current instruction, if applicable
member.remarks: Branch target is an instruction which would be called after current one if the condition for jump instruction is met. For non-jump instructions, the value is null.

member.summary: Reads all instructions from specified array of bytecode
member.param: Source byte array

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilReader.GetInstructions(System.Reflection.MethodBase)
member.summary: Reads all instructions from specified method's body
member.param: Source method
member.exception: Failed to retrieve method body for the method
member.returns: A collection of CIL instructions that form the body of this method

member.name: P:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilReader.Method
member.summary: Gets a method which body this CilReader object reads

member.name: P:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilReader.State
member.summary: Gets a current state of this CilReader object

member.name: T:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.Extensions.CilExtensions
member.summary: A collection of extension methods that provide an alternative syntax for some static methods of this library

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.Extensions.CilExtensions.GetCilGraph(System.Reflection.MethodBase)
member.summary: Returns that represents this method
member.param: Method for which to build CIL graph

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.Extensions.CilExtensions.GetCilText(System.Reflection.MethodBase)
member.summary: Returns this method's CIL code as string
member.param: Method for which to retrieve CIL
member.remarks: Alias for method. The CIL code returned by this API is intended mainly for reading, not compiling. It is not guaranteed to be a valid input for CIL assembler.

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.Extensions.CilExtensions.GetInstructions(System.Reflection.MethodBase)
member.summary: Retrieves all instructions from the method's body
member.param: Source method
member.exception: Failed to retrieve method body for the method
member.returns: A collection of CIL instructions that form the body of this method

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.Extensions.CilExtensions.GetExecutingInstruction(System.Diagnostics.StackFrame)
member.summary: Gets an currently executing instruction corresponding to this stack frame
member.param: A stack frame object

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.Extensions.CilExtensions.GetLastExecutedInstruction(System.Diagnostics.StackFrame)
member.summary: Gets a last executed instruction corresponding to this stack frame
member.param: A stack frame object

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.Extensions.CilExtensions.GetInstructions(System.Diagnostics.StackTrace)
member.summary: Gets a repesentation of this stack trace as CIL instructions
member.param: Stack trace object

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.Extensions.CilExtensions.PrintInstructions(System.Diagnostics.StackTrace,System.IO.TextWriter)
member.summary: Prints this stack trace, represented as a CIL code, into the specified TextWriter
member.param: Source stack trace object
Target TextWriter object. If null or omitted, standard output will be used.

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.Extensions.CilExtensions.GetReferencedMethods(System.Reflection.MethodBase)
member.summary: Gets all methods that are referenced by this method
member.param: Method for which to retrieve referenced methods
member.exception: Failed to retrieve method body for the method
member.remarks: Referenced member is a member that appears as an operand of instruction in source method's body. For example, if the source method calls `Foo` method or creates delegate pointing to `Foo`, `Foo` is referenced by the source method.

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.Extensions.CilExtensions.GetReferencedMethods(System.Type)
member.summary: Get all methods that are referenced by the code of this type
member.param: Type for which to retrieve referenced methods
member.remarks: Referenced member is a member that appears as an operand of instruction in any of the type's methods.

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.Extensions.CilExtensions.GetReferencedMethods(System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary: Get all methods that are referenced by the code in the specified assembly
member.param: Assembly for which to retrieve referenced methods
member.remarks: Referenced member is a member that appears as an operand of instruction in any of the assembly's methods.

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.Extensions.CilExtensions.GetReferencedMembers(System.Reflection.MethodBase)
member.summary: Gets all members (fields or methods) referenced by specified method
member.param: Method for which to retrieve referenced members
member.exception: Failed to retrieve method body for the method
member.remarks: Referenced member is a member that appears as an operand of instruction in source method's body. For example, if the source method calls `Foo` method or creates delegate pointing to `Foo`, `Foo` is referenced by the source method.

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.Extensions.CilExtensions.GetReferencedMembers(System.Type)
member.summary: Gets all members referenced by the code of specified type
member.param: Type for which to retrieve referenced memmbers
member.remarks: Referenced member is a member that appears as an operand of instruction in any of the type's methods.

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.Extensions.CilExtensions.GetReferencedMembers(System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary: Gets all members referenced by the code of specified assembly
member.param: Assembly for which to retrieve referenced members
member.remarks: Referenced member is a member that appears as an operand of instruction in any of the assembly's methods.

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.Extensions.CilExtensions.GetReferencedMembers(System.Reflection.MethodBase,CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.MemberCriteria)
member.summary: Gets members (fields or methods) referenced by specified method that match specified criteria
member.param: Method for which to retrieve referenced members
A combination of bitwise flags that control what kind of members are retrieved
member.exception: Failed to retrieve method body for the method
member.remarks: Referenced member is a member that appears as an operand of instruction in source method's body. For example, if the source method calls `Foo` method or creates delegate pointing to `Foo`, `Foo` is referenced by the source method.

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.Extensions.CilExtensions.GetReferencedMembers(System.Type,CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.MemberCriteria)
member.summary: Gets members referenced by the code of specified type that match specified criteria
member.param: Type for which to retrieve referenced memmbers
A combination of bitwise flags that control what kind of members are retrieved
member.remarks: Referenced member is a member that appears as an operand of instruction in any of the type's methods.

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.Extensions.CilExtensions.GetReferencedMembers(System.Reflection.Assembly,CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.MemberCriteria)
member.summary: Gets members referenced by the code of specified assembly that match specified criteria
member.param: Assembly for which to retrieve referenced members
A combination of bitwise flags that control what kind of members are retrieved
member.remarks: Referenced member is a member that appears as an operand of instruction in any of the assembly's methods.

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.Extensions.CilExtensions.EmitInstruction(System.Reflection.Emit.ILGenerator,CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilInstruction)
member.summary: Emits CIL code for the specified instruction into the specified IL generator.
member.param: Target IL generator.
IL instruction to be emitted.

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.Extensions.CilExtensions.EmitCilGraph(System.Reflection.Emit.ILGenerator,CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilGraph,System.Func{CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CilInstruction,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Emits the entire content of CIL graph into the specified IL generator, optionally calling user callback for each processed instruction.
member.param: Target IL generator.
The CIL graph which content should be emitted.
User callback to be called for each processed instruction.
member.remarks: Passing user callback into this method enables you to filter instructions that you want to be emitted into target IL generator. Return to skip emitting instruction, or to emit instruction.

member.name: T:CilTools.Reflection.CustomMethod
member.summary: A base class for MethodBase implementations providing custom mechanisms for extracting bytecode data. Inherit from this class when you want CilBytecodeparser to process bytecode from your custom data source, instead of reflection.

member.name: M:CilTools.Reflection.CustomMethod.GetBytecode
member.summary: When overridden in the derived class, returns the CIL bytecode of the method body

member.name: M:CilTools.Reflection.CustomMethod.GetLocalVarSignature
member.summary: When overridden in the derived class, returns the local variable signature as an array of bytes

member.name: M:CilTools.Reflection.CustomMethod.GetExceptionBlocks
member.summary: When overridden in the derived class, returns the list of exception handling blocks in the method's body

member.name: M:CilTools.Reflection.CustomMethod.GetLocalVariables
member.summary: Returns the array of local variable declarations of this method
member.remarks: The default implementation reads local varaibles from the signature returned by GetLocalVarSignature method

member.name: M:CilTools.Reflection.CustomMethod.PrepareMethod(System.Reflection.MethodBase)
member.summary: Converts MethodBase into the form suitable for processing by CilBytecodeParser

member.name: M:CilTools.Reflection.CustomMethod.CreateResolver(System.Reflection.MethodBase)
member.summary: Creates an object that can be used to resolve tokens in the context of specified method

member.name: P:CilTools.Reflection.CustomMethod.ReturnType
member.summary: When overridden in the derived class, returns the type of this method's return value
member.remarks: Return null if the return type is not applicable (such as for constructors).

member.name: P:CilTools.Reflection.CustomMethod.TokenResolver
member.summary: When overridden in the derived class, returns an object that can be used to convert metadata tokens into corresponding reflection objects

member.name: P:CilTools.Reflection.CustomMethod.MaxStackSize
member.summary: When overridden in the derived class, returns the maximum size of operand stack during method execution

member.name: P:CilTools.Reflection.CustomMethod.MaxStackSizeSpecified
member.summary: When overridden in the derived class, specifies whether the MaxStackSize property value is defined

member.name: P:CilTools.Reflection.CustomMethod.InitLocals
member.summary: When overridden in the derived class, specifies whether the local variables are initialized

member.name: P:CilTools.Reflection.CustomMethod.InitLocalsSpecified
member.summary: When overridden in the derived class, specifies whether the InitLocals property value is defined

member.name: T:CilTools.Reflection.ExceptionBlock
member.summary: Represents an exception handling block

member.name: M:CilTools.Reflection.ExceptionBlock.#ctor(System.Reflection.ExceptionHandlingClauseOptions,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Type,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new ExceptionBlock instance using provided property values

member.name: M:CilTools.Reflection.ExceptionBlock.FromReflection(System.Reflection.ExceptionHandlingClause)
member.summary: Creates new ExceptionBlock instance based on the specified reflection ExceptionHandlingClause object

member.name: P:CilTools.Reflection.ExceptionBlock.CatchType
member.summary: Gets the type of exception handled by the catch block

member.name: P:CilTools.Reflection.ExceptionBlock.FilterOffset
member.summary: Gets the offset of this block's exception filter within the method body, in bytes

member.name: P:CilTools.Reflection.ExceptionBlock.Flags
member.summary: Gets the value specifying the type of exception block

member.name: P:CilTools.Reflection.ExceptionBlock.HandlerLength
member.summary: Gets the length of this block's handler, in bytes

member.name: P:CilTools.Reflection.ExceptionBlock.HandlerOffset
member.summary: Gets the offset of this block's handler within the method body, in bytes

member.name: P:CilTools.Reflection.ExceptionBlock.TryLength
member.summary: Gets the length of this block's try clause, in bytes

member.name: P:CilTools.Reflection.ExceptionBlock.TryOffset
member.summary: Gets the offset of this block's try clause within the method body, in bytes

member.name: T:CilTools.Reflection.ITokenResolver
member.summary: Represents an object that can be used to convert metadata tokens into corresponding high-level reflection objects

member.name: M:CilTools.Reflection.ITokenResolver.ResolveType(System.Int32,System.Type[],System.Type[])
member.summary: Returns the type identified by the specified metadata token, in the context defined by the specified generic type parameters.

member.name: M:CilTools.Reflection.ITokenResolver.ResolveType(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the type identified by the specified metadata token.

member.name: M:CilTools.Reflection.ITokenResolver.ResolveMethod(System.Int32,System.Type[],System.Type[])
member.summary: Returns the method or constructor identified by the specified metadata token, in the context defined by the specified generic type parameters.

member.name: M:CilTools.Reflection.ITokenResolver.ResolveMethod(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the method or constructor identified by the specified metadata token.

member.name: M:CilTools.Reflection.ITokenResolver.ResolveField(System.Int32,System.Type[],System.Type[])
member.summary: Returns the field identified by the specified metadata token, in the context defined by the specified generic type parameters.

member.name: M:CilTools.Reflection.ITokenResolver.ResolveField(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the field identified by the specified metadata token.

member.name: M:CilTools.Reflection.ITokenResolver.ResolveMember(System.Int32,System.Type[],System.Type[])
member.summary: Returns the type or member identified by the specified metadata token, in the context defined by the specified generic type parameters.

member.name: M:CilTools.Reflection.ITokenResolver.ResolveMember(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the type or member identified by the specified metadata token.

member.name: M:CilTools.Reflection.ITokenResolver.ResolveSignature(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the signature blob identified by a metadata token.
member.returns: An array of bytes representing the signature blob.

member.name: M:CilTools.Reflection.ITokenResolver.ResolveString(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the string identified by the specified metadata token.

member.name: T:CilTools.Reflection.LocalVariable
member.summary: Represents local variable declaration in the method body

member.name: M:CilTools.Reflection.LocalVariable.#ctor(CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.TypeSpec,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new LocalVariable instance with the specified TypeSpec and index
member.param: TypeSpec object representing the variable type
Index of local variable within method body

member.name: M:CilTools.Reflection.LocalVariable.ReadSignature(System.Byte[],CilTools.Reflection.ITokenResolver)
member.summary: Reads local variables from the specified signature, resolving tokens using the specified ITokenResolver
member.param: Local variable signature as byte array
The object used to resolve metadata tokens
member.returns: An array of local variables read from the signature

member.name: M:CilTools.Reflection.LocalVariable.ReadSignature(System.Byte[],System.Reflection.Module)
member.summary: Reads local variables from the specified signature, resolving tokens within the scope of the specified module
member.param: Local variable signature as byte array
Module in which to resolve metadata tokens
member.returns: An array of local variables read from the signature

member.name: M:CilTools.Reflection.LocalVariable.FromReflection(System.Reflection.MethodBase)
member.summary: Reads local variables from the specified method's body
member.param: Source method
member.returns: An array of local variables read from the method body

member.name: P:CilTools.Reflection.LocalVariable.LocalTypeSpec
member.summary: Gets the TypeSpec object representing the variable type

member.name: P:CilTools.Reflection.LocalVariable.LocalType
member.summary: Gets the variable type

member.name: P:CilTools.Reflection.LocalVariable.LocalIndex
member.summary: Gets the index of local variable within the containing method body

member.name: P:CilTools.Reflection.LocalVariable.IsPinned
member.summary: Gets the value indicating whether the object pointed by local variable is pinned in memory

member.name: T:CilTools.Reflection.ModuleWrapper
member.summary: Resolves metadata tokens in the context of the specified module

member.name: M:CilTools.Reflection.ModuleWrapper.#ctor(System.Reflection.MethodBase)
member.summary: Creates ModuleWrapper object using the module containing the specified method

member.name: M:CilTools.Reflection.ModuleWrapper.#ctor(System.Reflection.Module)
member.summary: Creates ModuleWrapper object using the explicitly specified module

member.name: T:CilTools.Reflection.ModuleWrapperDynamic
member.summary: Resolves metadata tokens in the context of specified dynamic method

member.name: T:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CallingConvention
member.summary: Represents calling convention, a set of rules defining how the function interacts with its caller, as defined by ECMA-335

member.name: F:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CallingConvention.Default
member.summary: Default managed calling convention (fixed amount of arguments)

member.name: F:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CallingConvention.CDecl
member.summary: C language calling convention

member.name: F:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CallingConvention.StdCall
member.summary: Standard x86 calling convention

member.name: F:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CallingConvention.ThisCall
member.summary: Calling convention for C++ class member functions

member.name: F:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CallingConvention.FastCall
member.summary: Optimized x86 calling convention

member.name: F:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.CallingConvention.Vararg
member.summary: Managed calling convention with variable amount of arguments

member.name: T:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.Signature
member.summary: Encapsulates function's return type, calling convention and parameter types

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.Signature.#ctor(System.Byte[],System.Reflection.Module)
member.summary: Initializes a new Signature object representing a stand-alone method signature
member.param: The byte array containing StandAloneMethodSig data (ECMA-335 II.23.2.3)
Module containing the passed signature
member.exception: Signature contains generic types, function pointers or variable-bound arrays

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.Signature.GetParamType(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the type of parameter with the specified index
member.param: Index of the requested parameter
member.exception: Index is negative or outside the bounds of collection

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.Signature.GetParamTypes
member.summary: Gets the array of fixed parameter types that the function described by this signature takes

member.name: M:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.Signature.ToString
member.summary: Gets the textual representation of this signature as CIL code

member.name: P:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.Signature.CallingConvention
member.summary: Returns calling convention of the function described by this signature

member.name: P:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.Signature.HasThis
member.summary: Gets the value indicating whether the function described by this signature uses an instance pointer

member.name: P:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.Signature.ExplicitThis
member.summary: Gets the value indicating whether the instance pointer is included explicitly in this signature

member.name: P:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.Signature.ReturnType
member.summary: Gets the return type of the function described by this signature

member.name: P:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.Signature.ParamsCount
member.summary: Gets the amount of fixed parameters that the function described by this signature takes

member.name: P:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.Signature.ParamTypes
member.summary: Enumerates types of fixed parameters that the function described by this signature takes

member.name: T:CilTools.Syntax.BlockSyntax
member.summary: Represents the block syntax in the CIL assembler. The block contains child directive and instruction nodes.
member.remarks: The examples of block syntax are method body or exception handler blocks. The block consists of the optional header, opening curly brace, content nodes (directives and statements) and closing curly brace.

member.name: T:CilTools.Syntax.SyntaxNode
member.summary: Represents node in the syntax tree of Common Intermediate Language (CIL) assembler code. Classes that represent concrete language constructs derive from this class.

remarks.para: The SyntaxNode class instance contains all information required to produce the source code of the corresponding language construct, including whitespaces. The method returns all child nodes of this node, or an empty collection if it is a leaf (terminal node). Some child nodes may be exposed via specific properties as well. The text representation for non-terminal node is a string concetanation of all its child nodes' text representations.
Use method to get the syntax tree for the specified method.

member.name: M:CilTools.Syntax.SyntaxNode.ToText(System.IO.TextWriter)
member.summary: Writes text representation of this node into the specified TextWriter

member.name: M:CilTools.Syntax.SyntaxNode.EnumerateChildNodes
member.summary: Enumerates child nodes of this node. For the leaf node, returns an empty collection.
member.returns: The collection of child syntax nodes

member.name: M:CilTools.Syntax.SyntaxNode.ToString
member.summary: Gets the text representation of this node, including whitespace content
member.returns: The string containing CIL code of this syntax node

member.name: M:CilTools.Syntax.SyntaxNode.GetChildNodes
member.summary: Gets the array of this node's child nodes. For the leaf node, returns an empty array.
member.returns: The array of child syntax nodes

member.name: P:CilTools.Syntax.SyntaxNode.LeadingWhitespace
member.summary: Gets whitespace content at the beginning of this node's code
member.remarks: Besides the whitespace character itself, the returned string may contain line feed or carriage return characters. For efficiency purposes, the whitespace content, both syntactically meaningful and indentation-only, is stored withing one of the adjasent nodes, not in the separate node.

member.name: P:CilTools.Syntax.SyntaxNode.TrailingWhitespace
member.summary: Gets whitespace content at the end of this node's code
member.remarks: Besides the whitespace character itself, the returned string may contain line feed or carriage return characters. For efficiency purposes, the whitespace content, both syntactically meaningful and indentation-only, is stored withing one of the adjasent nodes, not in the separate node.

member.name: P:CilTools.Syntax.SyntaxNode.Parent
member.summary: Gets the parent node of this syntax node, or null if this node is root or not included in syntax tree.

member.name: P:CilTools.Syntax.BlockSyntax.HeaderSyntax
member.summary: Gets the header syntax of this, or an empty collection if this block has no header
member.remarks: For the exception handler blocks, the header represents the exception clause. Other types of blocks does not have headers.

member.name: P:CilTools.Syntax.BlockSyntax.Content
member.summary: Returns the collection of the syntax nodes contained within this block (content nodes)
member.remarks: The content nodes are located between opening and closing curly braces. They include instructions and directives.

member.name: T:CilTools.Syntax.CommentSyntax
member.summary: Represents the comment in the CIL assembler code. The comment does not impact code semantics in any way, but may provide extra information.

member.name: T:CilTools.Syntax.DirectiveSyntax
member.summary: Represents the directive in CIL assembler. The directive declaration starts from the dotted name.
member.remarks: The directive provides meta-information, such as the method's signature or the declarations of local variables.

member.name: M:CilTools.Syntax.DirectiveSyntax.WriteContent(System.IO.TextWriter)
member.summary: Writes text representation of this directive's content into the specified TextWriter

member.name: P:CilTools.Syntax.DirectiveSyntax.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of this directive

member.name: P:CilTools.Syntax.DirectiveSyntax.ContentString
member.summary: Gets the text representation of this directive's content

member.name: P:CilTools.Syntax.DirectiveSyntax.ContentSyntax
member.summary: Gets the collection of nodes that represent this directive's content

member.name: T:CilTools.Syntax.IdentifierSyntax
member.summary: Represents identifier in CIL assembler. Identifier is a name of the member or variable.

member.name: P:CilTools.Syntax.IdentifierSyntax.Content
member.summary: Gets the content of this identifier as string

member.name: P:CilTools.Syntax.IdentifierSyntax.IsMemberName
member.summary: Gets the value indicating whether this identifier represents assembly member name

member.name: T:CilTools.Syntax.InstructionSyntax
member.summary: Represents instruction syntax in CIL assembler
member.remarks: The instruction syntax consists of the optional label, operation name, and the optional operand

member.name: M:CilTools.Syntax.InstructionSyntax.WriteLabel(System.IO.TextWriter)
member.summary: Writes the label name of this instruction into the specified TextWriter

member.name: M:CilTools.Syntax.InstructionSyntax.WriteOperation(System.IO.TextWriter)
member.summary: Writes the operation name of this instruction into the specified TextWriter

member.name: M:CilTools.Syntax.InstructionSyntax.WriteOperand(System.IO.TextWriter)
member.summary: Writes the operand of this instruction into the specified TextWriter

member.name: P:CilTools.Syntax.InstructionSyntax.Label
member.summary: Gets the label name of this instruction

member.name: P:CilTools.Syntax.InstructionSyntax.Operation
member.summary: Gets the operation name of this instruction

member.name: P:CilTools.Syntax.InstructionSyntax.Instruction
member.summary: Returns the instruction instance corresponding to this node

member.name: P:CilTools.Syntax.InstructionSyntax.OperandString
member.summary: Gets the text representation of this instruction's operand

member.name: P:CilTools.Syntax.InstructionSyntax.OperandSyntax
member.summary: Gets the collection of nodes representing this instruction operand's syntax

member.name: T:CilTools.Syntax.KeywordKind
member.summary: Represents the kind of keyword in the node

member.name: F:CilTools.Syntax.KeywordKind.Other
member.summary: Unclassifed

member.name: F:CilTools.Syntax.KeywordKind.DirectiveName
member.summary: The name of directive

member.name: F:CilTools.Syntax.KeywordKind.InstructionName
member.summary: The name of instruction

member.name: T:CilTools.Syntax.KeywordSyntax
member.summary: Represents the keyword token in CIL assembler.
member.remarks: The keyword is a special sequence of characters that can't be used as identifier. The list of keywords is predefined by specification. The keyword could represent the directive name, access modifier, instruction name or other special syntactic element.

member.name: P:CilTools.Syntax.KeywordSyntax.Content
member.summary: Gets the value of this keyword as string

member.name: P:CilTools.Syntax.KeywordSyntax.Kind
member.summary: Gets the keyword kind

member.name: T:CilTools.Syntax.LiteralSyntax
member.summary: Represents the syntax of literal constant (such as numeric or string) in CIL assembler
member.remarks: Literal constant value is inlined directly in the source code. Typically literal syntax is used to represent the operand of the instruction.

member.name: P:CilTools.Syntax.LiteralSyntax.Value
member.summary: Gets the value represented by this literal

member.name: T:CilTools.Syntax.MemberRefSyntax
member.summary: Represents the reference to the assembly member (such as type, method or field) in CIL assembler
member.remarks: The member reference syntax is used as instruction operand or in variable declarations.

member.name: P:CilTools.Syntax.MemberRefSyntax.Member
member.summary: Gets the reflection construct representing the referenced member

member.name: T:CilTools.Syntax.MethodDefSyntax
member.summary: Represents the syntax of the method definition in CIL assembler
member.remarks: Method definition consists of the signature ("header") and the body. The body can contain directives (such as custom attributes or local variable declarations) and instructions.

member.name: P:CilTools.Syntax.MethodDefSyntax.Signature
member.summary: Gets the directive representing the signature of the defined method

member.name: P:CilTools.Syntax.MethodDefSyntax.Body
member.summary: Gets the block the forms the body of the defined method

member.name: T:CilTools.Syntax.PunctuationSyntax
member.summary: Represents the punctuation sign token in CIL assembler
member.remarks: Punctuation signs divide other tokens in syntax constructs. Punctuation signs used in CIL are colons, braces, angle braces and others.

member.name: P:CilTools.Syntax.PunctuationSyntax.Content
member.summary: Gets the value of this punctuation sign as string

member.name: T:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.ElementType
member.summary: Represents signature element type as defined in ECMA-335

member.name: F:CilTools.BytecodeAnalysis.ElementType.Void
member.summary: The absence of return value

member.summary: Reference type
